job_title: Cardiac Rehab Manager in Greenville, OH
pros: Small hospital, with a caring staff. The whole hospital makes a great team, everybody is willing to help everybody.
cons: Really cannot think of any cons. I love working here.

reviewer_affiliation: Current Temporary Employee, less than 1 year
pros: I went to Edison State and after I finished my program I applied to Wayne. I’ve been here for two weeks now and I’m liking it so far. I interned at Reid and after having that experience there I can say the two places are very different. I like the people at Wayne because there seems to be less drama with a smaller hospital. The pay isn’t plead either for being my first phlebotomy job.
cons: At Reid there is a Registrar that puts all the orders in and prints it for the phlebotomist. I really liked this because I could look at what I needed and draw right away. At Wayne you have to look at the patients registration paper yourself and upload all their test and print what labels you will need. I haven’t been there long, so I can’t say too much for now.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Greenville, OH
cons: Pay, management, hours, cafeteria closed most of the night

pros: Close knit community/family environment, competitive pay compared to local competitors
cons: No cons not present at most healthcare locations
There is a Lack of leadership
Pay, short staffing, very catty employees

review_title: Good people, Administration not so good.
pros: The employees were caring and friendly.
cons: Upper management did not hold themselves to the same standards as everyone else.

pros: great atmosphere, great benefits, overall great place to work
cons: small hospital with little room for growth
